column5: re getting rid of the Inbox tab.
s right, your social inbox now lives inside Monitoring. If you still call the product &ldquo
column7: now is a good time to switch to calling it Hubspot Social.

column4: background-color: transparent"">2. We upgraded Social Stream creation. The flow is still similar but now creation happens in the new visual design.

background-color: transparent"">3. How you address messages in the inbox has changed. In the old inbox you would scroll through messages and if you look at them they would be marked as read. In the new inbox you need to click the circle on the left hand side to archive a message. Use the &ldquo

background-color: transparent"">With this update the entire Social tool is now in the new visual design! The update also moves inbox into Monitoring which in many ways served the same purpose. Having only Monitoring consolidates tools and improves the user experience. It also helps us have less of an extreme focus on Twitter as a social tool.

3,Publishing,,,,1,Can you publish to personal Facebook feeds from HubSpot?,,,,,"

What is it?

Starting on August 1, users of HubSpot’s social tool will no longer be able to publish to a personal Facebook profile from HubSpot. Only publishing to Facebook pages will be supported going forward.

Why the change?

Facebook recently announced that they would no longer support third party applications posting to personal Facebook feeds. As a result, users will only be able to publish to a Facebook page going forward. This update will align Facebook’s publishing permissions with Instagram within HubSpot. Connecting a Facebook page to HubSpot lets you fully take advantage of all the features available within our social tool. For example, within social monitoring you can only reply to comments on your posts if they were made to a page on Facebook.

Who does this affect?

Only about 2% of all connected social accounts are personal Facebook feeds. Those customers will see the following in-app banner when they log into the social tool, alerting them of the change.

This attached spreadsheet includes portals that publish the most frequently to a personal Facebook profile, and their account manager. If you manage one of the heavily affected portals, we ask that you reach out to inform them of this change.

 

What language is it in?

All languages supported by HubSpot.

Source: Product Notification

",string,,,

3,Publishing,,,,2,Manage Your Social Media through the Social Calendar,,,,,"

What is it?

Within social publishing, you can now manage your social media schedule through a drag and drop calendar.

Why does it matter?

For social marketers, ensuring that you have a consistent stream of content to engage your audience is essential. Maybe you determine one post a day on Instagram yields the best results, while for Twitter you want to aim for 6-10 posts a day. Whatever cadence works best for your audience, being able to visualize which posts are going out on a specific day and drag and drop posts as you see fit will ensure that you never miss an opportunity to engage with your audience where they are spending the most of their time.

How does it work?

Within social publishing, click the calendar icon to access the social calendar.

Here, you’ll see all of your published and scheduled social posts organized in a calendar view. You can see your posts by either month, week, or you can zero in on a specific day. At the top, you can also filter your posts by account, their associated campaign, or what type of post they are.

If you notice that a post scheduled for Friday would be better suited for Thursday - no problem! Simply select the post and drag it over to Thursday. Your scheduled post will automatically be updated.

Who gets it?

This feature is live in all portals.

What language is it in?

All languages supported by HubSpot.

column13: text-decoration: none""> a change to their stance on tweet automation to deter users from artificially amplifying certain messages. This means that social tools like HubSpot will no longer be able to allow users to schedule or publish the same tweet from multiple accounts.

column6: text-decoration: none"">Inbound marketing is predicated on providing your customers with useful and relevant content. When using social channels such as Twitter for Inbound, the focus should be on engaging with your audience and building brand awareness - not scheduling the same post across the accounts you manage to artificially increase views on your latest blog post or to influence a trending hashtag. Twitter's announcement shows they are changing their platform towards an inbound approach that will encourage brands to engage with their audiences in a more engaging, meaningful way. &nbsp

column7: s new stance on tweet automation, we will be making changes to how our users will post content to Twitter through our Social tools. In the next couple of weeks:

3,Publishing,,,,8,The New HubSpot Social Media Tools,,,,,"

Big Picture:

How people use social media has changed. In the last 5 years social has become more mobile, more, visual, more ad powered, and more scientific. On top of this, Facebook is rapidly innovating and changing the definition of social media. Unfortunately, what hasn&rsquo
column3: s Social Media product. Part of the reason why is because it&rsquo
column4: s a well built tool, that solves a need. But last year we recognized we were behind the times, and have made it a priority to address, and invigorate HubSpot Social. Around 6 months ago we added a new fully dedicated product team, including a new hire PM from LinkedIn. This team quickly put together a 3-step plan to usher HubSpot back to the forefront of what&rsquo
column5: s new and exciting in social. On Tuesday (5/30) we'll introduce Phase 1 of that plan to all of our customers.

column1: The HubSpot 3-Step product plan to recharge Social Media.
• Refresh the look and feel of Social by converting it to the new visual UI. As this is happening fix major issues and customer pain points in UX and functionality of the tool.
• Add features that support the current state of social media. This includes incorporating features that support publishing video, emojis and Instagram for social media marketing.

• Re-think the use case of the tool and add features around emerging social media marketing strategies. This might include support for Facebook Messenger, new networks or other tools that are currently emerging as powerful social marketing strategies.
Click here to read more on this approach and where Social Media at HubSpot is headed.
Starting Tuesday (May 30th) all customers will be able to opt-in to the new, refreshed version of HubSpot Social. We&rsquo
column2: re targeting June, 6th as the date to switch all users over to the version of social, with the ability to opt-out for a 24-hour period grace period if needed.

column1: We will update this email thread when the opt-out change happens. Our goal is to completely move all customers to the new social tools by July 6th. We&rsquo
column2: ll be email all social users and working with CSMs to make sure customers are aware and excited about this switch.

column1: • May 30th : All users will see the option to switch to the new social tools.
• June 6th : All users will be defaulted to the new social tools with the option to opt out for 24 hours.
• July 6th : The ability to opt out will be removed and the new social tools will be the only option.
1) Upload and Publish Video to Facebook from HubSpot

column2: re in the beta group you&rsquo
column3: ve already seen some of these exciting social updates. What you haven&rsquo
column4: t seen is the ability to upload videos from HubSpot to Facebook. Those videos will autoplay on Facebook and will function just as if they have been uploaded from Facebook. This is a major &ldquo
column7: s going to save our customers time and increase the performance of video on Facebook. We know that video is out performing all other types of content and that it&rsquo
column8: s something our customers are actively trying to master.

column1: • There is a separate gate for this video feature, and for it to work a portal must also be ungated for the new File Picker.
Request access for the Facebook Video Upload here.

column2: t have the ability to change the video thumbnail at this time.

column1: • Video-centric metrics won't be available in reports at this time.

column2: s uploaded from HubSpot to Facebook will perform just as well as those uploaded from Facebook in the eyes of the Facebook algorithm.

column1: • There are no new limits on File Picker bandwidth and usage at this time.
2) The Look and feel: The majority of the Social has been converted to the new visual UI. We&rsquo
column2: re working to also update Inbox and Monitoring over the next few weeks. You&rsquo
column3: ll see them go into an open beta soon.

column1: 3) Settings: Along with the new UI we redefine how users connect social accounts. Users no longer have to connect their personal social account to connect their business account. A major point of frustration from users. Also, once a business account is connected all users can use HubSpot to manage it, creating a single source of truth for the account.

4) Composing: We used the visual UI update as an opportunity to totally re-engineer how composing and publishing works in Social. Users can now compose multiple social posts on different networks in one view. No more tabbing between posts. They can drag and drop images into compose without opening file manager. They can save compositions as drafts and tag other company pages on Facebook via compose. The tool will also tell users if they are using the wrong image format when publishing to Facebook. All of these changes reduce friction and greatly improve the user experience in social.

5) Reporting: Along with the new UI, we simplified the social reports dashboard, and refocused the dashboard on metrics that impact the bottom line, instead of the typical vanity metrics associated with social. This helps bring the tool inline with the update way marketers think of social ROI.

* Please note: The new Social Reports no longer reports on the number of new followers. Instead it shows you percentage growth of followers. A technical limitation makes it hard for us to get really accurate data on this metric. It&rsquo
column2: s also a metric that has less to do with business impact, making it less valuable for most marketers. But it is important to some customers and we want to hear their feedback and concerns.

column1: Social has changed and this phase 1 refresh is a huge first step towards modernizing the social tools. It paves the way for more innovative social updates that our customers need to succeed.

3,Publishing,,,,9,Publishing to LinkedIn Groups Being Sunset,,,,archived,"

What is it:

LinkedIn is removing API support for Groups. This means publishing to LinkedIn Groups from HubSpot will no longer be possible. This affects all Social Media Publishing tools including Buffer, Hootsuite, Sprout Social, and others. The only way to publish to groups, will be through the native LinkedIn desktop interface.
Support for LinkedIn Groups will end on 6/30.
In advance of this, we will turn off the ability to add new LinkedIn Groups and prevent users from being able to schedule messages to LinkedIn Groups after 6/30 on 6/23.
This is a moderately used feature inside of the Social Media tools and we want to make sure that customers know their options and aren&rsquo
column2: t blindsided by the lack of support. We also want customers to know this is due to a change on LinkedIn&rsquo

column1: Any customers who publishes from HubSpot Social to a LinkedIn Group.

column2: ll share an external blog post, in-app message, and notification center message about the deprecation of this feature.

column1: When you talk to customers let them know that we&rsquo
column2: re no longer supporting this feature, as of 6/30. We made this change because LinkedIn removed the ability from the API we use to publish to the platform. After 6/30 the only way to post to groups is through the native LinkedIn desktop interface. We still think LinkedIn is a great place to share inbound content and reach prospects but Groups don&rsquo
column3: t have the impact to build a community they once did. but we&rsquo
column4: re always interested to find new ways to help our customers use LinkedIn to grow.

column1: Marketers with LinkedIn Groups may be using HubSpot to publish to LinkedIn. That posting now needs to happen through LinkedIn. If customers are heavily invested in LinkedIn Groups now is a good time to rethink that strategy. LinkedIn is starting to support less features for groups. Additionally updates from Groups are rarely surfaced in a user's feed, and there is no support for Groups in the LinkedIn app. LinkedIn groups may not be the high ROI social activity which they once were.

3,Publishing,,,,13,Facebook Video Support for Social Publishings,,,,,"

What is it?
HubSpot Social now supports video publishing to Facebook. All Marketing users can now upload video to Facebook via the HubSpot Social tool. This only works for Facebook.
Click here to try it out in your portal.
column3: Once in HubSpot click compose > Facebook > video icon.

column1: 2017 has been the year of video in social. Facebook has prioritized it. You probably have noticed your news feed dominated by video now. It&rsquo
column2: s what people want. Video clearly outperforms all other types of content on social and is an amazing story telling device for marketers. Now that people have powerful phones and constant access to WiFi and 4g networks, streaming video is fast and easy. This update eases the work required by marketers to upload video to Facebook. Making it easier for them to add it to campaigns.

column1: Users will now see a video play button option when creating a Facebook post. Clicking on this option opens a window that lets them find a video file or they can simply drag and drop one into the publisher. Once the file is added the video will upload and user can post them to Facebook. The video will post as a native Facebook video.
This update is part of the new Social tools and is available to all HubSpot Marketing customers.

3,Publishing,,,,14,Twitter Card View for HubSpot Blog Content,,,,,"

What is it:

Blog content created, and shared, within HubSpot now supports the Large Image Twitter cards. This is now the default option for blog content being shared automatically, or via the updated social tools.
In this example, content has a small image with text on the right-hand side. Clicking on the image, or the text brings the reader directly to the blog post.

column2: ll notice a much larger image and text underneath. This card functions the same way as the previous example - that is, by clicking on it the user will be taken to the content, but is far more likely to be interacted with due to its size.

column1: You want blog content to get found and social is a key place to participate in the conversation, and attract readers. This update makes any blog posts created within HubSpot more likely to get noticed, and thus interacted with on Twitter.
This new Twitter Card is enabled for automatically shared blog posts or social posts that share HubSpot-hosted blog content.
If a user does not want to share a post with the new Twitter Card view, within the social tool they can switch it to a photo post following the instructions below:
• Get a link of the blog post and head to the new Social tools
• Compose Message, and paste a link to the blog post you want to share on the screen

column2: ll see a button appear in the upper-right that allows you to switch to a photo post.

column1: This change is now live for all HubSpot customers.

column1: 3,Publishing,,,,17,Manage Your Social Media through the Social Calendar,,,,in-beta,"

column4: text-decoration: none"">Within social publishing, you can now manage your social media schedule through a drag and drop calendar.

text-decoration: none"">For social marketers, ensuring that you have a consistent stream of content to engage your audience is essential. Maybe you determine one post a day on Instagram yields the best results, while for Twitter you want to aim for 6-10 posts a day. Whatever cadence works best for your audience, being able to visualize which posts are going out on a specific day and drag and drop posts as you see fit will ensure that you never miss an opportunity to engage with your audience where they are spending the most of their time. &nbsp
text-decoration: none"">Within social publishing, click the calendar icon to access the
text-decoration: none"">

column5: ll see all of your published and scheduled social posts organized in a calendar view. You can see your posts by either month, week, or you can zero in on a specific day. At the top, you can also filter your posts by account, their associated campaign, or what type of post they are.

column4: text-decoration: none"">If you notice that a post scheduled for Friday would be better suited for Thursday - no problem! Simply select the post and drag it over to Thursday. Your scheduled post will automatically be updated.

column1:
Enterprise users of HubSpot’s social tool can now report on the success of their YouTube Channels directly within HubSpot.

Why does it matter?

Video is king when it comes to social content. We currently spend upwards of six hours a day consuming video content, and that number is only going to keep growing. If you’re serious about expanding your presence on social, you’re regularly creating content on YouTube, and promoting it to your audience.

But once your video content is created, you need to know how it is being received by your target audience. With YouTube reporting in HubSpot, you can begin to track your overall YouTube performance over time, and analyze how specific videos are performing against others, in the same system you use to report on the rest of your social channels. See what resonates with your audience, and fully lean into your YouTube strategy.

How does it work?

Within Social settings, Enterprise portals will now have the option of connecting a YouTube account to HubSpot.

Once connected, navigate to social reports, and from the drop down of connected accounts, select your newly connected YouTube account. A YouTube dashboard will then appear giving you an overview of your YouTube engagement. You’ll be able to track average watch time, subscriber growth over a period of time, the number of interactions on each post, and even dive deep into statistics on an individual video basis.

Who gets it?

This is now in an open beta. If one of your Marketing Hub Enterprise Customers wants access, feel free to reply here and we’d be happy to add them. Once out of beta, this feature will be available to all Marketing Hub Enterprise users.

Sharing the news with customers

Feel free to share this product update blog post with any interested customers.

What language is it in?

All languages supported by HubSpot.

Source: Product Notifications

4,Reports,,,,2,Does HubSpot's Social Reports enable you to determine the best time to publish social content?,,,,,"

No, the social tools do not enable users to identify the optimal publishing times. This differs form other tools such as email where HubSpot provides suggestions on email send times.

To determine social engagement by time you need to export data to excel. From there you can do manual data analysis to identify the most effective times for your organization. This article describes the process.

5,Social Settings,,,,1,[Now Live] Facebook Page Locations,,,,,"

What is it?
Users of the HubSpot social tool with many location specific Facebook pages can now see this information within HubSpot, ensuring that their Facebook posts go to the correct page.

Why does it matter?

Facebook locations lets you easily create a parent-child relationship between your location specific Facebook pages and your corporate brand page. For example, if you are a retail store, and you have three different locations, each with their own Facebook page, you’ll want to be able to create content specific for those pages, and also your larger corporate brand page.

This is easy to do natively on Facebook, but within HubSpot, we didn’t pull location specific information regarding a page. This led to a situation where multiple Facebook pages could be connected to HubSpot, all with the same name and no way to identify which page corresponds to a specific location. With this update we’ll now incorporate location specific information into the name of your connected Facebook Page, so you can easily manage multiple locations for one brand, all within HubSpot.

How does it work?

Connected Facebook pages that have a value for the Facebook field “name with location” will include location specific information in the account name in parentheses. There is no specific action users need to take for this to work.
Now, when creating posts for an individual location’s page, you’ll be able to easily differentiate one location from another.

Who gets it?

This is now available to all Marketing Hub Professional and Enterprise users of the social tool.

Sharing the news with customers

Feel free to share this product update blog post with any interested customers.

What language is it in?

All languages supported by HubSpot.

Source: Product Notifications

5,Social Settings,,,,2,How does HubSpot integrate with Facebook Lead Ads?,,,,,"

Facebook Lead Ads -

When someone clicks on your lead ad, a form opens with the person’s contact information automatically populated, based on the information they share with Facebook, like their name and email address. Automatically populating the contact information that people share with Facebook makes filling in the form as fast as two taps: one click on the ad to open the form and another to submit the autofilled form. Like all of our ad types, lead ads were built with privacy in mind. People can edit their contact information before submitting the form, and this information isn’t sent to the business until a person clicks “submit.”
